title: Web Developer Tools Engineer - Careers at Apple

last_post.content:
Apple are hiring a “web tools engineer”. This is the team that works on #webdriver, the Web developer tools, the WebKit Inspector and more.

My experience with the folks on this team is that they’re great to work with, and they care deeply about the work they do. The progress in safaridriver over the past year has been driven by them, and it’s been brilliant to see.

https://jobs.apple.com/en-us/details/200482392/web-developer-tools-engineer?team=SFTWR

title: Books by Daniel H. Wilson (Author of Robopocalypse)

last_post.content: @bajabanjo @pluralistic my son (and I!) enjoyed books by Daniel H. Wilson. We started with "How to Survive a Robot Uprising" (humorous and you pick up all sorts of robotics info). Author has more books but we did not read all of them. Son moved on to Tom Clancy. Mostly you just want kids to keep the reading habit going and not push too hard. https://www.goodreads.com/author/list/33773.Daniel_H_Wilson
@bajabanjo @pluralistic I can recommend https://nostarch.com/ada-zangemann which really inspired my 9 year old.

Adoption of a barrel at Nevel Wild Ales!
Nevel (https://nevel.org) is a brewery making "wild and sour ales, straight from nature" with a mission to "reconnect people with nature". I've got news for you: a freshly printed #calendar! Marketing your paper product in an early modern setting. This detail of an #almanac selling pedlar was part of the title page of an #almanac/#calendar that was produced to be sold. The title? "Der aufrichtige Kalendermann: Ein gar kurioses und nützliches Buch ; Für die Jugend und den gemeinen Bürger und Bauersmann" from 1794. #bookhistory #histodons

title: Twitter and Reddit's high-priced APIs are bad news for the internet's future

last_post.content:
There is a solution to this. Stop centralizing the internet.

If you want to take back control of the internet, we need to go back to blogging, using internet forums, and transition to the Fediverse with software that powers it like Mastodon, Calckey, Pixelfed, etc.

We need to stop making places like Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Reddit, Tiktok, etc the center of the internet. At any time, they can pull the rug as seen with Twitter numerous times and Reddit charging outrageous fees for their API.

Using the Fediverse isn't that hard. Sure, onboarding could be better, but once one starts using it, they will get used to it. Also, #bluesky is never the solution.

https://mashable.com/article/social-media-paid-api-internet-future

title: Construction starts on Nevada’s Thacker Pass lithium mine

last_post.content:
This weekend I visited #ThackerPass, where the largest lithium mine in the US is under construction on lands of cultural and historical significance to the Paiute, Shoshone and Washoe people, near the #Nevada / #Oregon border.

Impacted tribes have not given consent for the open pit mine, but the Biden administration and a federal judge have approved it to supply lithium for electric vehicle batteries.

#GreenColonialism #JustTransition #EVs
